Title:
Phylogeny of Velarifictorus micado species complex from COI
gene sequences (Orthoptera: Gryllidae)
Keywords:
Velarifictorus micado, speciation, COI gene,
phylogeny
Abstract:
The crickets, Velarifictorus micado has a wide distribute
in East Asia and also invading USA. In Japan, they have two patterns of
life-cycle, both are univoltine, but one overwinters at egg and the
other at nymphal stage. We sequenced and analized COI gene of 33
individuals from China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Vietnam, Cambodia and USA.
The results showed that the US populations include two genotypes and one
is derived from China. Two different life-cycle patterns in Japan
evolved from two coloniziation histories, one from North China and
another from Taiwan.
